intro: Lysimachia dextrorsiflora, commonly known as the right-facing flower, is a species of flowering plant in the Primulaceae family. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its flowers are usually borne on long, slender stalks and bloom in the spring. Lysimachia dextrorsiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display.
